metadata.synopsis: Default camp dialog for Shadowheart's dad. He has started to  recover from her ordeal in the Shar grotto.He has unique branches for Shadowheart and non-Shadowheart players, as well as branches that occur before and after CAMP_Shadowheart_DaughterTears, in which SH and her parents have their first proper heart to heart following their reunion.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Add Shadowheart's dad to the camp2, Talk to him

5.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
5.text: Shadowheart, my darling. All is well, I hope.

9.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
9.text: I'm starting to feel like my old self again. And Jen - I mean Shadowheart - has been able to unbottle some of the feelings that Shar denied to her.

82.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
82.text: A great deal of damage was done to our family, but we can still heal.

38.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
38.text: My wife will need care. I wish to find somewhere quiet, close to nature. Where the sun can warm us, and the moon can watch over us as we sleep.

36.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
36.text: And Shadowheart too may wish to join us perhaps, with her fine paramour at her side - once you've put down this 'Absolute' threat together.

30.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
30.text: And Shadowheart too may wish to join us perhaps, once she's helped you put down this 'Absolute' threat.

86.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
86.text: I've gleaned enough from word around this camp to know you're more than capable. You will prevail.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You accept your daughter's choice of name?

92.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
92.text: Of course. Only a fool would alienate his child over a name. Shadowheart must determine her own path - that is what the Moonmaiden teaches.

1.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
1.text: Still, I am... unused to it. I can only hope she forgives a slip of the tongue now and again, until I adapt.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: So you're a lycanthrope? Shadowheart shared some of her memories with me.

111.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
111.text: I am, but with Selûne's guidance, I learned how to control the beast long ago - I only let it loose again when my family was threatened.

106.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
106.text: Unfortunately I was unable to stop what befell us, as neither elf nor wolf.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: What happened during all those years? What did they make your daughter do to you?

15.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
15.text: You've shown great kindness, allowing my wife and I to remain with you. Thank you. I'm glad Jenevelle found you.

10.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
10.text: You are more than just a friend to her, aren't you? I saw the way she looked at you. It reminded me of her mother, when we first met.

29.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
29.text: Don't worry - I am truly glad she found you, and I have scant energy to play the stern father.

91.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
91.text: There must be stories you could tell... but perhaps another time.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: That name - I'm still not used to hearing it.

80.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
80.text: Nor is Jenevelle. Perhaps that is something I shall need to talk to her about, when the time is right.

112.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
112.text: I'm afraid my strength has not returned just yet. Decades in that place has left me maimed, body and soul.

35.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
35.text: Some rest, perhaps, will make me better company.

57.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
57.text: She is strong... but she is also human. The years were harder on her than on me, in both body and mind. Shar's pit robbed us of precious time we can never have back.

37.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
37.text: Whatever we have left, I must make count for double - triple. But later, perhaps. I still need time to recover my strength.

40.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
40.text: Whatever Jenevelle wishes of us. She still has other fights. But when she's ready, we'll be there. To be a family again.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What happened during all those years? What did they make your daughter do to you?

94.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
94.text: I'm sorry, but what happened in that room... it must stay within the family. Just know that we endured, and are grateful for your help.
94.context: NodeContext: Firmly but politely shutting down the question

48.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
48.text: We will talk again soon, my sweet. Once I've had some time to gather myself.

65.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
65.text: Jen - I mean, Shadowheart, pardon. It warms my heart to see you.
65.context: NodeContext: Accidentally using Shadowheart's birth name (slip of the tongue) before correcting himself

6.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
6.text: I had promised you we would catch up once I'd rested - perhaps there's something you wish to ask about.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: What really happened that night in the woods, when I was abducted?

104.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
104.text: You were to come of age that night - left alone in the woods, and using only Selûne's guidance to find your way back to us.

100.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
100.text: But you were not alone in the woods. We caught a Sharran spy near our village, and learned that his accomplices sought to abduct you.

97.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
97.text: I had to find you - to bring you home - and I had to do it quickly. In my haste, I made a terrible mistake.

54.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
54.text: I took on my wolf-form to cover the ground more quickly. And it worked - I followed your scent, and reached you before the Sharrans could.

16.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
16.text: But when I found you, you did not see your father, rushing to save you - you only saw a wolf, hunting you in the darkness.

95.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
95.text: I should have told you of my curse before that night. Then... everything would have been different.

66.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
66.text: You panicked, and before I could explain, the Sharrans found us. Father and daughter. Wolf and prey.

39.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
39.text: When I awakened, you were gone, but your mother was with me. They were spiriting us away to the city, hidden and bound.

76.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
76.text: That should have been the day you came of age, and into the Moonmaiden's teachings.

44.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
44.text: Instead, the Sharrans used us to teach you different lessons. Painful lessons.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: How is it you could transform into a wolf at will?

81.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
81.text: The Moonmaiden's blessings are many. She taught me to control the curse - but she could not teach me to control my paternal instincts.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm sorry. This would never have happened if I hadn't been frightened, if I hadn't ran.

7.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
7.text: You must not blame yourself. You were a child; your mother and I were supposed to protect you.

12.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
12.text: We grew complacent - underestimated the depths of Shar's bitterness, the fanaticism of her followers.

83.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
83.text: But perhaps this was always meant to be. Perhaps the Moonmaiden's path was merely longer for you than we knew.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Why did nobody else help you? Or come to search for us?

24.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
24.text: Perhaps they did - ours was a small community, spread thin.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: All these years... you were so close by. And I did nothing.

31.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
31.text: You could have done nothing back then - not without putting yourself in danger. The Moonmaiden guided you in her own time.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You're not upset, are you? About my name?

109.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
109.text: A name is nothing. Your happiness is what matters. Just... forgive your father the occasional slip of the tongue. I will adapt, given time.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: If you're a lycanthrope, does that mean I am also?

3.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
3.text: Well it depends - do you find yourself more hirsute at certain times, craving warm flesh? Actually no - spare your father the answer to that.

110.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
110.text: I am a lycanthrope, but your mother is not. It was a toss of the coin to determine if you inherited that side of me.

89.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
89.text: If you have not changed after all this time, I believe you are safe.

52.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
52.text: I've heard enough about this 'Absolute' threat to understand it cannot be ignored. Your mother and I can wait until you prevail - and I know you will.

90.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
90.text: Beyond that, your mother will need my care - and yours too, if you wish to join us.

69.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
69.text: Somewhere quiet, close to nature. Where the sun can warm us, and the moon can watch over us as we sleep.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You promised you'd tell me what I did to you both. I'm ready to hear it now.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: They made me do things to you both, all those years. Please - I need to know.

50.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
50.text: Are you sure, Shadowheart...? Picking at old wounds may not serve any purpose...
50.context: NodeContext: Reluctant. Wants to shield his daughter.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Please. I need to understand, if I'm to move on.

4.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
4.text: Very well... but I shall not wallow in ugly details. That is what they would have wanted - to have let their physical torments live on in our spirits. I will not allow that.
4.context: NodeContext: Conceding, but on his non-negotiable terms,

63.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
63.text: They had you use us for... practice. All the techniques that the Sharrans hold pride in. Trickery, interrogation... torture. They even had you, our own daughter, try to convert us.
63.context: NodeContext: Difficult for him. Decades of painful memories touched upon in a couple of phrases.

87.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
87.text: The worst part was not anything you did to us - it is what they had done to you. You didn't recognise us. Those eyes I had wiped tears from now looked at me like a stranger.

88.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
88.text: I... I feared I would give in then, but your mother's strength bolstered me. She never gave up calling you daughter, no matter what you said. Or did.

13.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
13.text: We were still a family, in that room. Suffering. Enduring. But we did not give up. Your mother and I swore we would see the look of recognition in your eyes once again. And we did.

51.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
51.text: Don't be. Knowing you were out there gave us the strength to hold on. And you returned to us, just like you were supposed to, all that time ago.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: How did you both go on like that? I could never have the strength...

14.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
14.text: Knowing you were out there still was enough to sustain us. And you are stronger than us both, daughter. We merely had to endure - you had to choose your path. One that brought you back to us, at last.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: What about the wound on my hand? Was that to hurt me, or you?

28.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
28.text: Both. They marked you before our eyes. They said it would discipline you for straying, while extending our torment also.

103.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
103.text: Not just with the pain, but with the knowledge that every time we felt it, your true self was being punished, for trying to break through their indoctrination.

2.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
2.text: Yes. Now you know all that is worth knowing. Let us put this behind us, for good.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: There is nothing old about these wounds - they've never been allowed to heal. I would know.

74.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
74.text: Jenevelle. I still can't believe you freed us - that I'm standing here with you. I'd ask you to slap me so I know it's real, but I don't think I'm yet strong enough to bear it.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: There's so much I want to ask about.

72.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
72.text: I can only imagine. It may take a little time before I'm fit to give many answers though. Forty years in captivity have left my mind... cobwebbed. But it will clear, given some rest.

0.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
0.text: I should gather my strength. I've waited so long for this, a little longer won't do any harm...

75.speaker: Player
75.text: That name. I don't know how I feel about it.

93.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
93.text: Give it time. Give us time. This is a great deal to take on at once - for me as well.

49.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
49.text: She is strong... but she is also human. The years were harder on her than on me, in both body and mind. Shar's pit robbed us of precious time we can never have back.

33.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
33.text: But do not worry. We're together again - and we will make every moment count all the more.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: They made me do things to you both, all those years. Please - I need to know.

19.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
19.text: Perhaps... perhaps later, my girl. That is a hard thing to talk about. I fear I do not have the strength for it just yet.
19.context: NodeContext: Reluctant. Dodging a painful subject

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You should rest. There'll be time to talk later.

78.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
78.text: You have your mother's wisdom. Yes. I should gather my strength. I've waited so long for this, a little longer won't do any harm...

99.speaker: Arnell Hallowleaf
99.text: Forgive me, I am still weak - aching limbs, fogged mind. I'll prove better company after I've rested, I assure you.
